tool.name: SiriusAdapter
tool.description: Tool for metabolite identification using single and tandem mass spectrometry
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && #if $in_featureinfo: mkdir in_featureinfo && ln -s '$in_featureinfo' 'in_featureinfo/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_featureinfo.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_featureinfo.ext)' && #end if #if $out_sirius_FLAG: mkdir out_sirius && #end if #if $out_fingerid_FLAG: mkdir out_fingerid && #end if #if $out_ms_FLAG: mkdir out_ms && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && echo ARGS && cat '$args_json' && echo HARD && cat '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' #if $in_featureinfo: -in_featureinfo 'in_featureinfo/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_featureinfo.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_featureinfo.ext)' #end if #if $out_sirius_FLAG: -out_sirius 'out_sirius/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' #end if #if $out_fingerid_FLAG: -out_fingerid 'out_fingerid/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' #end if #if $out_ms_FLAG: -out_ms 'out_ms/output.${gxy2omsext("sirius.ms")}' #end if #if not($out_sirius_FLAG) and not($out_fingerid_FLAG) and not($out_ms_FLAG): | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if $out_sirius_FLAG: && mv 'out_sirius/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' '$out_sirius' #end if #if $out_fingerid_FLAG: && mv 'out_fingerid/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' '$out_fingerid' #end if #if $out_ms_FLAG: && mv 'out_ms/output.${gxy2omsext("sirius.ms")}' '$out_ms' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: MzML Input file

param.name: in_featureinfo
param.label: FeatureXML input with feature and adduct information

param.name: out_sirius_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_sirius (MzTab Output file for SiriusAdapter results)

param.name: out_fingerid_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_fingerid (MzTab output file for CSI:FingerID, if this parameter is given, SIRIUS will search for a molecular structure using CSI:FingerID after determining the sum formula)

param.name: out_ms_FLAG
param.label: Generate output out_ms (Internal SIRIUS .ms format after OpenMS preprocessing)

param.name: out_workspace_directory
param.label: Output directory for SIRIUS workspace

param.name: filter_by_num_masstraces
param.label: Features have to have at least x MassTraces
param.help: To use this parameter feature_only is neccessary

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window for precursor selection (Feature selection in regard to the precursor)

param.name: precursor_mz_tolerance_unit
param.label: Unit of the precursor_mz_tolerance

param.name: precursor_rt_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance window (left and right) for precursor selection [seconds]

param.name: isotope_pattern_iterations
param.label: Number of iterations that should be performed to extract the C13 isotope pattern
param.help: If no peak is found (C13 distance) the function will abort. Be careful with noisy data - since this can lead to wrong isotope patterns

param.name: feature_only
param.label: Uses the feature information from in_featureinfo to reduce the search space to MS2 associated with a feature

param.name: no_masstrace_info_isotope_pattern
param.label: Use this flag if the masstrace information from a feature should be discarded and the isotope_pattern_iterations should be used instead

param.name: profile
param.label: Specify the used analysis profile

param.name: candidates
param.label: The number of candidates in the SIRIUS output

param.name: database
param.label: search formulas in given database

param.name: noise
param.label: median intensity of noise peaks

param.name: ppm_max
param.label: allowed ppm for decomposing masses

param.name: isotope
param.label: how to handle isotope pattern data
param.help: Use 'score' to use them for ranking or 'filter' if you just want to remove candidates with bad isotope pattern. With 'both' you can use isotopes for filtering and scoring. Use 'omit' to ignore isotope pattern

param.name: elements
param.label: The allowed elements
param.help: Write CHNOPSCl to allow the elements C, H, N, O, P, S and Cl. Add numbers in brackets to restrict the maximal allowed occurrence of these elements: CHNOP[5]S[8]Cl[1]

param.name: compound_timeout
param.label: Time out in seconds per compound
param.help: To disable the timeout set the value to 0

param.name: tree_timeout
param.label: Time out in seconds per fragmentation tree computation

param.name: top_n_hits
param.label: The number of top hits for each compound written to the CSI:FingerID output

param.name: cores
param.label: The number of cores SIRIUS is allowed to use on the system

param.name: auto_charge
param.label: Use this option if the charge of your compounds is unknown and you do not want to assume [M+H]+ as default
param.help: With the auto charge option SIRIUS will not care about charges and allow arbitrary adducts for the precursor peak

param.name: ion_tree
param.label: Print molecular formulas and node labels with the ion formula instead of the neutral formula

param.name: no_recalibration
param.label: If this option is set, SIRIUS will not recalibrate the spectrum during the analysis

param.name: most_intense_ms2
param.label: SIRIUS uses the fragmentation spectrum with the most intense precursor peak (for each spectrum)

param.name: converter_mode
param.label: Use this flag in combination with the out_ms file to only convert the input mzML and featureXML to an .ms file

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Tool for metabolite identification using single and tandem mass spectrometry
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_SiriusAdapter.html
